hackathon-description-text: AND HERE WE GO, TIME FOR THE 6TH ANNUAL IDHACK!

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Senior Associate at Bankable Frontier Associates

hackathon-eligibility: Any Boston based hackers with an interest in working with NGOs, making the world a better place, and winning cool prizes.
hackathon-requirements:
In order to be eligible for grading please include the following with your submission:

PLEASE follow these guidelines or you will not be eligible for prizes!

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The most impressive project in terms of technological accomplishments, design appeal, and real world applicability.
The second most impressive project in terms of technological accomplishments, design appeal, and real world applicability.
The third most impressive project in terms of technological accomplishments, design appeal, and real world applicability.
An award given most impressive project in terms of technological accomplishments, design appeal, and real world applicability put together by a team with a primarily diverse background.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=200 College Ave, Somerville, MA 02144, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: The project completes the request provided by the NGO in a reasonable manner.
The submission shows technical skill and effort in Computer Science.
The project is visually appealing, easy to learn, and easy to use.
The project is designed in such a way that it can have an impact with the target community.

hackathon-location-description: Tufts Univerity Science and Engineering Complex (SEC)
